name: AlinaLutherConversation
_source: s;Alina;Come now, my dear, close your eyes.|See the memories of distant days.|Listen, they can be heard again.|They're imprinted on your heart...
s;Luther;Your voice is bewitching. Not unlike your mother's.
s;Alina;Thank you.{w} I'm still surprised you knew I was her daughter.|We rarely performed together.
s;Luther;She was the only other minstrel who could bring that song to life.
s;Alina;Is it a favorite of yours?{w} I would be happy to play it again.
s;Luther;I don't dare tire a beautiful voice such as yours.|This was more than enough.|But if I may, does your mother still perform.
s;Alina;Ah... no. The Vesner flu took her a few years ago.
s;Luther;I'm terribly sorry to hear that.|Our world is worse for her passing.
s;Luther;I appreciated her talent, nothing more.|There was never any... improper...
s;Alina;Oh, I didn't mean to suggest that at all.|Despite my peers' mocking, my mother wasn't a whore.
s;Alina;Oh! Excuse my language. A... loose woman.|Or, whatever the proper term is.
s;Luther;Yes, of course.{w} Alina, I hope you will bear her legacy.
s;Alina;I think that might be the first time someone's asked that of me.|It's always the opposite!|But, yeah... I'd like to do that too.
